title: TravelBot
description: The first JavaScript project for Technigo's frontend developer bootcamp, meant to give students a grasp of JS fundamentals. Built using variables, functions, control flow, and conditional statements/ternary operators.

title: Guess Who-game
description: A digital take on the classic game 'Guess Who?', created using array methods such as filter(), forEach() and map(). This project taught us about JavaScript scope, and how to use objects and arrays.

title: Weather App
description: An app showing weather information with the free API from OpenWeatherMap. This project gave us an insight into working with APIs, basic JSON, using fetch(), promises and so on. Built with fellow Technigo student Ajmal Zahir.

title: Music Releases
description: My first React project, showcasing Spotify music releases from the spring of 2023. Repetition of map() and API usage. New concepts include React components, modules, JSX, and props. Built with fellow Technigo student Malwina Polak

title: The Afrobeats Quiz
description: A simple survey using controlled form inputs. This project introduced the concept of state in React, and familiarized us with the useState hook and how to show different components depending on one's place in a survey.

title: FlixList
description: A project that familiarized us with React Router, and how to handle a site built in React with several pages.

title: Design Hand-off
description: A collaboration with Technigo's UX Design Bootcamp student Alice Wennberg, who created the design. Created with React and styled entirely with styled components.

title: React-Redux Quiz
description: A multiple-choice quiz game to test your React knowledge, made using Redux. My first project using Redux.

title: ToDo App
description: A todo app made using React, Redux and styled components. This project gave us a chance to work with and edit the Redux store.

title: The Labyrinth
description: An 8-bit-style labyrinth game created with React, Redux and a game API from our bootcamp. Created with fellow Technigo students Sara Battilotti and Ajmal Zahir.

title: IT Salaries 2020
description: A RESTful API built using Node.js and Express, and my first time delving into the backend side of programming. The frontend showcasing the API is built with React, and gave me a chance to continue practicing React Router.

title: PlantMama
description: My final project at Technigo's frontend developer bootcamp. A fullstack app that helps plant-owners care for and keep track of their houseplants. The app also offers species-specific plant care tips and inspiration. Built in collaboration with fellow frontend developer Sara Battilotti, design by UX designer Marianela Garc√≠a.

title: Wordee
description: My first React Native project. A simple word app that randomly generates a word and its definition. Built with two separate APIs, this gave me a chance to both test out React Native and combine multiple APIs. If I had money laying around, I would also try publishing the app on the App Store.
